main event: A bright, white unidentified object was observed in the sky over the Dayton, Ohio area on July 13, 1962.
interesting points: The object was first sighted moving from northwest to northeast, and was visible for approximately 5 minutes.
The object appeared to slow down, stop, and then proceed again in the same direction.
The witness estimated the size of the object to be approximately 50 feet in diameter and flying at a lower altitude.
The object had double red lights or windows and seemed to be under control, moving in a southwest direction.
The object was brighter than the brightest stars and did not produce any sound.
